newsitem.title: UK: ITF adds two more convenience flag nations.
newsitem.headline: ITF adds two more convenience flag nations.

text.p: The International Transport Workers Federation (ITF) said today it was adding two nations to its list of designated flags of convenience (FOCs).
The Seafarers' Union said it was adding Aruba and Cambodia to the list of FOCs.
The ITF added that a number of other countries' shipping registers are under investigation, including Ukraine, the Philippines, Singapore and Madeira.
The investigations are likely to be completed within 12 months.
The ITF takes action against FOCs because it claims that operators using those shipping registers do not pay sufficient wages or employ seafarers under good enough conditions.
The ITF also confirmed that it will take a 15-20 day long campaign of action against FOCs in the Asia-Pacific region in November or December this year.
It will also have a worldwide week of action in the summer of 1998.
